src:
Graham Hansen markerte seg i Barcelona-storseier
Caroline Graham Hansen startet scoringsballet for de spanske serielederne Barcelona i 5-0-seieren over Levante.
03 Nov 2019, 15:08 by NTB
Scoringen kom fem minutter f칮r pause. Da banket Graham Hansen inn 1-0 p친 et skudd fra kort hold.
Alexia Putellas 칮kte til 2-0 p친 straffe f칮r lagene gikk i garderoben. Barcelona fikk straffen etter at Graham Hansen ble revet ned inne i feltet.
Jennifer Hermoso scoret to ganger helt mot slutten av kampen f칮r Kheira Hamraoui fastsatte sluttresultatet til 5-0 p친 overtid.

Caroline Graham Hansen bidro til snuoperasjon da Barcelona gikk videre

Barcelona leder klart og har vunnet sju av 친tte kamper denne sesongen. Den siste har endt uavgjort.
N친 tar den spanske serien en liten pause, mens landslagene er opptatt med EM-kvalifisering. Graham Hansen og Norge skal m칮te Nord-Irland i Stavanger fredag.


Ingrid Syrstad Engen scoret da serieleder Wolfsburg vant 8-0 p친 bortebane i Bundesliga s칮ndag.游닝 Marit Hommedal / NTB scanpix

Storseier for Engen og Minde i Tyskland
Flere nordmenn har v칝rt i aksjon i de st칮rste ligaene i Europa s칮ndag.
Ingrid Syrstad Engen nikket inn det siste m친let p친 overtid da Wolfsburgs kvinnelandslag i fotball vant hele 8-0 borte mot Freiburg.
Engen spilte hele kampen, mens Kristine Minde kom inn for venstrekant Ewa Pajor ved pause og spilte 2. omgang. Pajor og Pernille Harder hadde scoret to ganger hver i f칮rste omgang, etter et tidlig lederm친l signert Zsanett Jakabfi.
I 2. omgang fullf칮rte Harder sitt hattrick, mens Sara Bj칬rk Gunnarsd칩ttir og Engen scoret hver sin gang i sluttminuttene.
Wolfsburg har vunnet alle sine ni seriekamper s친 langt i sesongen, med 42-3 i total m친lscore. Freiburg p친 6.-plass ble et lett bytte. Wolfsburg er tre poeng foran Hoffenheim og seks foran Bayern M칲nchen.

Hegerberg fortsetter 친 b칮tte inn m친l



Karina S칝vik og hennes Paris Saint-Germain avga poeng for f칮rste gang i h칮st med 1-1 mot Guingamp s칮ndag.游닝 Paul Sigve Amundsen / NTB scanpix

S칝viks PSG mistet serieledelsen
I Frankrike var Karina S칝vik i aksjon s칮ndag. Hun ble byttet inn i det 82. minutt, men kunne ikke hjelpe Paris Saint-Germain til et vinnerm친l mot Guingamp i s칮ndagens uavgjorte seriekamp.
Sara D칛britz ga PSG ledelsen framspilt av danske Nadia Nadim tidlig i 2. omgang, men et selvm친l av Paulina Dudek i det 72. minutt ga gjestene utligning.
S칝vik kom inn for stjernespissen Kadidiatou Diani og spilte ni minutter pluss ti tilleggsminutter hvor PSG forgjeves jaget vinnerm친let.
Etter sju seirer p친 rad m친tte PSG t친le sitt f칮rste poengtap, og dermed mistet laget ogs친 f칮rsteplassen p친 tabellen til Ada Hegerbergs Lyon, som vant sin kamp l칮rdag. Lyon har 32 plussm친l mot PSGs 28.
text:
Graham Hansen made his mark in the Barcelona big win
Caroline Graham Hansen started the scoring ball for Spanish league leaders Barcelona in the 5-0 win over Levante.
03 Nov 2019, 15:08 by NTB
The scoring came five minutes before the break. Then Graham Hansen knocked in 1-0 on a short-range shot.
Alexia Putellas increased to 2-0 on penalties before the teams entered the locker room. Barcelona received the penalty after Graham Hansen was demolished inside the field.
Jennifer Hermoso scored twice all the way to the end of the match before Kheira Hamraoui set the final score to 5-0 in overtime.

Caroline Graham Hansen contributed to the turnaround as Barcelona went ahead

Barcelona are leading the way and have won seven of eight matches this season. The last one has ended in a draw.
Now the Spanish series takes a little break, while the national teams are busy with European qualifying. Graham Hansen and Norway will meet Northern Ireland in Stavanger on Friday.


Ingrid Syrstad Engen scored when series leader Wolfsburg won 8-0 away in the Bundesliga on Sunday.游닝 Marit Hommedal / NTB scanpix

Grand win for Engen and Minde in Germany
Several Norwegians have been in action in the biggest leagues in Europe on Sunday.
Ingrid Syrstad Engen nodded the final goal of overtime as Wolfsburg's women's soccer team won the entire 8-0 away against Freiburg.
The Widow played the entire game, while Kristine Minde came in for left-hander Ewa Pajor at the break and played the 2nd half. Pajor and Pernille Harder had scored twice each in the first place, after an early manager goal signed Zsanett Jakabfi.
In the second half, Harder completed his hat trick, while Sara Bj칬rk Gunnarsd칩ttir and Engen each scored each time in the final minutes.
Wolfsburg has won all of its nine series matches so far this season, with 42-3 in total goal scoring. Freiburg in 6th place was an easy switch. Wolfsburg is three points ahead of Hoffenheim and six ahead of Bayern Munich.

Hegerberg continues to kick in goals



Karina S칝vik and her Paris Saint-Germain scored points for the first time in the fall with 1-1 against Guingamp on Sunday.游닝 Paul Sigve Amundsen / NTB scanpix

S칝vik's PSG lost the series lead
In France, Karina S칝vik was in action on Sunday. She was substituted in the 82nd minute, but could not help Paris Saint-Germain in a winning goal against Guingamp in Sunday's draw.
Sara D칛britz gave PSG the lead played by Danish Nadia Nadim early in the second half, but a goal by Paulina Dudek in the 72nd minute gave the visitors equalization.
S칝vik came in for star striker Kadidiatou Diani and played nine minutes plus ten extra minutes where PSG in vain chased the winning goal.
After seven wins in a row, PSG had to endure their first point loss, thus losing the team first place on the table to Ada Hegerberg's Lyon, who won their match on Saturday. Lyon has 32 plus goals against PSG's 28.
